summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel, DOJ attorneys, and other officials coordinating the distribution of invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a meeting (likely a victim briefing related to the Epstein case). The emails discuss confirming victim identities, attorney representation, contact information, and logistical details for the meeting.

persons.name: Bob Josefsberg
persons.context: Mentioned as an attorney whose office represents multiple victims; the FBI is waiting for his current client list to forward to the DOJ.

persons.name: Allen
persons.role: FBI Program Manager, Victim Services Division
persons.context: Appears as an FBI Program Manager in the Victim Services Division, involved in coordinating the meeting invitation process and reporting to management.

connections.description: Bob Josefsberg's office is stated to represent multiple victims, as the FBI is waiting for his client list.
Allen is coordinating with DOJ and FBI colleagues on logistics for sending meeting invitations to victims and their attorneys.

events.title: Scheduled victim meeting
events.description: A meeting for which invitations and RSVP questionnaires are being distributed to victims and their attorneys.

events.title: Invitation distribution
events.description: Invitations were sent via email to 14 attorneys, 6 victims, and a family member of a deceased victim.

keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were coordinating a victim meeting scheduled for November 12, 2020, related to the Epstein case.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
Attorney Bob Josefsberg's office represented multiple victims, and the FBI was awaiting his current client list.
The correspondence shows efforts to confirm victim identities and contact information, including noting a victim's passing earlier in 2020.
The document highlights the FBI Victim Services Division's role in facilitating communication between victims and the government.
